abstract: The maker of Cheerios is paying a 37 percent premium, for “natural” macaroni and cheese purveyor Annie’s Homegrown. But big companies often squash growth when they swallow small targets whole, notes Kevin Allison of Reuters Breakingviews.
snippet: The maker of Cheerios is paying a 37 percent premium, for “natural” macaroni and cheese purveyor Annie’s Homegrown. But big companies often squash growth when they swallow small targets whole, notes Kevin Allison of Reuters Breakingviews.
lead_paragraph: General Mills risks smothering its latest acquisition target.

headline.main: The Risk in the General Mills Deal for Annie’s
